snippet: The decision came after criticism that Chadian soldiers were siding with Muslim militias against Christians fighting a bloody sectarian conflict.
abstract: Chad says it is withdrawing troops from African Union-led peacekeeping mission in Central African Republic; decision comes after criticism that Chadian soldiers were siding with Muslim militias against Christians fighting a bloody sectarian conflict.

byline.original: By SOMINI SENGUPTA and ALAN COWELL
byline.contributor: Somini Sengupta reported from the United Nations, and Alan Cowell from London.

lead_paragraph: The decision came after criticism that Chadian soldiers were siding with Muslim militias against Christians fighting a bloody sectarian conflict.

headline.main: Chad, Amid Criticism, Will Pull Troops From Force in Central Africa
headline.print_headline: Chad, Amid Criticism, Will Pull Troops From Force in Central Africa

keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
keywords.name: subject
